title: How to Remove Yourself from Duolingo: Computer & Mobile

steps.title: Log into your Duolingo account on Duolingo’s website.
steps.content: Log into your Duolingo account on Duolingo’s website. Hit the "I Already Have an Account" button to be redirected to the login screen, where you can plug in your password. Duolingo may remember the last username/profile you used, so you’ll only need to type in the password.

steps.title: Head to the Duolingo Drive-Thru page.
steps.content: Head to the Duolingo Drive-Thru page . Duolingo’s Drive-Thru page allows to either ask for a copy of your data that Duolingo has on file, or request for all the Duolingo accounts associated with your login to be shut down. This includes auxiliary Duolingo accounts, like Duolingo ABC and Duolingo for Schools.

steps.title: Click the Erase Personal Data option.
steps.content: Click the Erase Personal Data option. Duolingo warns that this process might not be instant, and that it may take up to a month for your account(s) to be deleted. Still, this is all you need to do on your end—once you hit that button, your account will be deleted. [1] X Research source Note: Deleting your account doesn’t automatically cancel any Duolingo subscriptions you had. If you have ongoing Duolingo subscriptions, proceed to the How to Cancel Duolingo Subscriptions section for further instructions.

steps.title: Tap the icon of a cartoon avatar (the profile tab).
steps.content: Tap the icon of a cartoon avatar (the profile tab). The Duolingo app doesn’t label the tabs at the bottom of the screen, so select the icon of the woman with purple hair to access your profile. Currently, this sits between an icon of a shield and a notification bell. Warning: This won’t work on Android devices.

steps.title: Hit the gear icon in the top-right corner to access your settings.
steps.content: Hit the gear icon in the top-right corner to access your settings. This will redirect you to the settings page.

steps.title: Swipe down to the bottom of the settings page and hit Delete Account.
steps.content: Swipe down to the bottom of the settings page and hit Delete Account . According to Duolingo’s “Help” page, this option is available at the bottom of the settings page. [2] X Research source Be sure to cancel any existing subscriptions you have separately. Note: Some iOS users have had trouble finding this button in their Duolingo apps. If this happens to you, access your account on the web to delete your account.

steps.title: iOS
steps.content: iOS Open the “Settings” app. Tap your name and icon. Tap “Subscriptions.” Select your Duolingo subscription. Tap “Cancel Subscription” and confirm your selection. Be sure to do this at least 1 day before your subscription is set to renew, otherwise you might be charged anyway.

steps.title: Android
steps.content: Android Head to the “Payments & subscriptions” page of the Google Play Store. Go to the “Subscriptions” tab. Cancel your existing Duolingo subscription from there.

steps.title: Web
steps.content: Web This method will only work if you haven’t deleted your Duolingo account yet. Log into your profile on the web browser of your choice. Hover over the “Profile” tab on the left side of your screen and hit “Settings.” Use the “Subscription” section on the right side of the screen to update and cancel your Duolingo subscription.
